name: Replacing single use plastic commodities in the economy of Suriname
description:

Involve locals in the production of replacement bags.</p><p>Indirectly: reduce environmental pollution caused by plastics.</p>

name: Small Grants Programme on Plastic Waste: Round 3
Development of an innovative approach to plastic waste treatment in Cameroon
description: The objective of the project is to contribute to the reduction of plastic waste pollution, to contribute to the empowerment of women and to contribute to the erection of ecological houses at affordable prices.<br />In particular, the objectives are:<br />1. Reduce the plastic waste: Through this project, we will establish a collection system for plastic bottles with a minimum monthly volume to be reached that will be used as raw material for the manufacture of ecological tiles. The transformation of plastic waste into building material results in the reduction of the volume of waste in the oceans and improves the environment. The volume of waste collected serves as an indicator of the impact of our action on the environment.<br />2. Nature conservation: The transformation of plastic waste into building material results in the reduction of the volume of waste in the oceans and improves the environment. The volume of waste collected serves as an indicator of the impact of our action on the environment.<br />3. Promote the empowerment of women: By employing more women in our project, we are empowering them with secure employment. They will be encouraged to create plastic waste collection canters and be self-sufficient.<br />4. Reduce the cost of building houses: Thanks to building materials made of plastic waste, building will no longer be a difficult mission for people with limited income. Our durable, eco-friendly tiles will be sold at an affordable price compared to traditional tiles<br />

description: The objectives of the project are:<br />1. To recycle plastic bottles (PET and HDPE type) into valuable products such as pavement tiles and flowerpots through which the environment will be saved, job opportunities will be created and will be income generation business to street children and economically disadvantaged and socially marginalized women.<br />2. To establish a sound plastic bottle collection scheme&nbsp;<br />3. To review the legal frameworks to identify the gaps and provide recommendations in order to ensure Environmentally Sound Management (ESM) of plastic waste and to prevent and minimize its generation.&nbsp;<br />4. To establish a market chain for the recycled products&nbsp;<br />5. To create awareness in selected institutions and commercial centres on plastic bottle handling

name: Support the development of a plastic inventory of Plastic Waste Flows in Latin America and the Caribbean
description: The objectives of the project are to:<br />1. Provide guidance and tools to enhance the monitoring and improve the understanding of national plastic waste flows (i.e. plastic placed on the market - POM, plastic waste generated - WG, plastic waste officially reported and collected, imports and exports of plastic waste).&nbsp;<br />2. Train relevant authorities and organizations on the plastic waste tools for the quantification of plastic POM and plastic waste generated.<br />3. Assist countries in mapping the plastic waste flows.&nbsp;<br />4. Support the countries in identifying plastic waste management pathways, including in the informal sector.<br />5. Develop national capacities to regularly monitor the plastic flows.<br />6. Develop recommendations for improving the monitoring of plastic waste flows in the long term (also after the completion of the project).&nbsp;<br />7. Allow relevant stakeholders to be better informed about the plastic waste flows in the selected countries through workshops, stakeholder interviews and dissemination material

Improve capacities and capabilities of Mongolia and Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK) for the environmentally sound management of single-use-plastic and its waste;<br />2. Improve capacities and capabilities on the environmentally sound management of plastic waste and restrict the import of illegal plastic waste of Pakistan;<br />3. Prevent and minimize the generation and adverse impacts of single-use plastic waste, and introduce environment friendly and cost-effective alternatives of plastic waste to protect human health and environment;<br />4. Share lessons learned with all Asia-Pacific countries, and other countries, as appropriate.

description: To provide a comprehensive understanding of the material flows of plastics and plastic waste through the economy of the island. Pivotal to this, is the building of capacity to conduct material flow assessment (MFA) and life cycle assessment (LCA) to encourage repeatability over the medium term.

implementedBy.name: Ministry of Environment and National Beautification (MENB)

brs_umbrellaName: Pilot projects of the Basel Convention Plastic Waste Partnership
brs_objectives: To provide a comprehensive understanding of the material flows of plastics and plastic waste through the economy of the island. Pivotal to this, is the building of capacity to conduct material flow assessment (MFA) and life cycle assessment (LCA) to encourage repeatability over the medium term.
brs_activities: <p>Activity 1. Review of the existing policy, institutional and legislative instruments governing the plastics, plastic waste management and transboundary movement of plastics and plastic waste.</p><p>Activity 2. Conduct of a Material Flow Assessment (MFA) and Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) of plastics across all sectors of the economy of Barbados.&nbsp;</p><p>Activity 3. Conduct a feasibility study of available opportunities for the recovery, reuse, repurposing, and recycling of plastics and plastic waste and plastic substitutes/alternatives that are environmentally friendly.</p><p>Activity 4. Develop a Plastics Management Policy and Action Plan to advance circularity of plastics and encourage recovery, reuse, repurposing, recycling and substitution of plastics.</p>
